text:
SPEAKER 1: People told
me it couldn't be done.

SPEAKER 2: This was too
big a problem to tackle.

SPEAKER 1: But we were
too impatient to wait.

We saw a future that was
better for billions of people
and it was achievable.

If I hadn't questioned
our education system,

I never would have unleashed
the curiosity, conviction,

and courage of
tomorrow's leaders.
[CHEERING]

SPEAKER 2: If I'd
given into poverty,

I would never have created
an economic powerhouse,

restoring homes for
America's working class.

SPEAKER 1: If I'd
accepted the status quo,

I wouldn't be helping to create
a sustainable greener form
of transportation--

SPEAKER 2: --or keeping
100,000 items of clothing
out of landfills every day.
So rethink what's possible.

SPEAKER 1: Blaze a new trail and
rewrite the rules of the game.

SPEAKER 3: Don't
give in to fear.

Don't fight uncertainty,
because that's
where resilience is forged.

SPEAKER 2: Don't just
climb the ladder;
follow what's calling you.

SPEAKER 1: And best of all, just
smile at the naysayers as you

take every small
but hard one step
towards making a difference.

Because the world desperately
needs gutsy leaders like you.
SPEAKER 4: Yes, you.

SPEAKER 5: What difference
will you make in the world?
